comment._content: Here's this pic as it appeared in the Australian Town & Country Journal in June 1904 (the top one) - nla.gov.au/nla.news-article71511066

comment.author: 35179849@N08
comment._content: Ormuz lol.  Thats the cockney way of saying Hormuz,  as in Strait of..,  where world war 3 is going to start.

comment.author: 51979177@N02
comment._content:
London, 1903 

[phone rings]

Ullo! Horrient line 'ere, Smifkins speakin'...

Look Smithkins, my name is Inspector Doggesley, and I'm from the Yard. I'm ringing to investigate a complaint we've received from the Foreign Office about the way you've been spelling the names of your boats. We've been told that you're dropping your aitches for goodness sake!

Geez guvna'...yeah well I fink wot happen'd like is that wunnerv th' paynters dropp'd their stencil fer th' letter aytch darn a 'ole in th' dock, an they've bin sort erv makin do wivvout till they kin getter replaycemint.

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/mich2009] [http://www.flickr.com/photos/51979177@N02]Ha ha! Many of the Orient Line ships' names started with an "O" - en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Orient_Steam_Navigation_Company

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: From these advertisements (SMH 6/1/1904 p.1) - trove.nla.gov.au/ndp/del/article/14591066 The ORMUZ was due to leave Sydney on 30 January (see Orient ad col.4 top) The DUMBEA was due to leave on 1 February (see MM ad col.3 half way down) Also the MOLDAVIA was due to leave on 6 February (see P&O ad col.3 top). This is very possibly the ship seen in the photo to the left. She arrived at that P&O wharf on 27 Jan ... ... which all suggests this panorama was taken between 27-30 January 1904 ??

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/51979177@N02] The ZIETEN is looking good - she is flying the appropriate German flag in this pic - [http://www.flickr.com/photos/powerhouse_museum/2363510276/] I have the ZIETEN leaving Sydney on 30/1/1904 - trove.nla.gov.au/ndp/del/article/14596250 , but no arrival date yet ...

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: Here we are - the ZIETEN arrived on 17/1/1904 - trove.nla.gov.au/ndp/del/article/14593667 Updated dates - ORMUZ ... Arr 16 Jan ... Dep 30 Jan DUMBEA ........19 ... ... ... ... .. 1 Feb ZIETEN ... ... ...17 ... ... ... ... ..30 Jan MOLDAVIA ... ..27... ... ... ... ... 6 Feb (possibly wrong ship?) So discounting the MOLDAVIA, between 19-30 January - including MOLDAVIA 27-30 January.
